content:
Hi I’m Kenny and I have a passion for analytics and machine learning. I recently graduated with a Ph.D from the University of Alberta under the supervision of professor Natalia Ivanova. My research involved using a numerical simulations, statistical analysis and data visualization to model stellar systems resulting in numerous scientific publications. Throughout my graduate research I gained experience in machine learning, data analysis, and high performance computing. I am currently looking to start a career in data analytics or machine learning.
Image from Jakub Ostrowski Photography.
summary: Hi I’m Kenny and I have a passion for analytics and machine learning. I recently graduated with a Ph.D from the University of Alberta under the supervision of professor Natalia Ivanova. My research involved using a numerical simulations, statistical analysis and data visualization to model stellar systems resulting in numerous scientific publications. Throughout my graduate research I gained experience in machine learning, data analysis, and high performance computing. I am currently looking to start a career in data analytics or machine learning.
title: Kenny X. Van

summary: A Jupyter notebook predicting if a passenger survived.
title: Titanic - Machine Learning from Disaster

summary: An interactive dashboard showing Game of Throne Kills
title: Game of Thrones Kill Dashboard

summary: Tableau Dashboard showing sales informationa cross the USA
title: Tableau Sales Map

summary: A Jupyter notebook analyzing housing prices.
title: House Prices - Advanced Regression Techniques

summary: Edmonton neighbourhood analysis using Python and FourSquare
title: Neighbourhood Analysis

summary: I show the derivation and effectiveness of our new magnetic braking scheme, the CARB MB.
title: Constraining Progenitors of Observed LMXBs Using CARB Magnetic Braking

summary: We derive and introduce a new magnetic braking scheme which can effectively reproduce a sample of well studied observed LMXBs.
title: Evolving LMXBs: CARB Magnetic Braking

summary: A poster presenting preliminary results of our new magnetic braking prescription and its effectiveness in reproducing observed LMXBs
title: Inverse Population Synthesis Searching for The Origins

summary: A study of the most commonly used magnetic braking prescription and how effectively this prescription can reproduce observed LMXBs. We definitively show that the most commonly used prescription fails to reproduce observed systems and should not be used.
title: Low-mass X-ray binaries: the effects of the magnetic braking prescription

summary: A poster summarizing the effectiveness of different magnetic braking prescriptions in reproducing observed LMXBs
title: Low Mass X-ray Binaries Population at Roche Lobe Overflow

summary: Showed that there is a range where mass transfer from massive giants onto a black hole is stable. This significantly reduced the simulated BH-BH binary formation rate to fall in line with LIGO observations.
title: Formation of Black Hole X-Ray Binaries with Non-degenerate Donors in Globular Clusters

summary: A poster presenting preliminary work of a statistical study of different magnetic braking prescriptions
title: Low Mass X-ray Binaries Population at Roche Lobe Overflow

summary: A poster presentation showing the results from the paper Stability of mass transfer from massive giants: double black hole binary formation and ultraluminous X-ray sources.
title: Stability of Mass Transfer From Massive Giants

summary: Presented an alternative method in producing black hole X-ray binaries where a black hole captures a subgiant donor and strips a significant amount of mass off the donor.
title: Stability of mass transfer from massive giants: double black hole binary formation and ultraluminous X-ray sources

summary: A poster presentation showing the results from the paper Stability of mass transfer from massive giants: double black hole binary formation and ultraluminous X-ray sources.
title: Stability of Mass Transfer From Massive Giants
